thread.title: Two plays open on South Plains stages
thread.title_full: Two plays open on South Plains stages

author: Staff
title: Two plays open on South Plains stages
text:
Two plays open on South Plains stages Theater Box Posted: October 16, 2015 - 12:01am 
“Smile and Nod: An Old-Fashioned Vaudeville” — 7:30 p.m. Friday-Saturday, CATS Playhouse, 2257 34th St. Directed by Pat Price. General admission tickets $14 for the general public, and $12 for students and seniors. 792-0501 or visit catsplayhouse.com. 
Future performances on Oct. 23-24. 
“The Uninvited” — 7:30 p.m. Friday-Saturday and 2 p.m. Sunday, Helen DeVitt Jones Theatre at South Plains College, E.M. Barnes Drive and Magnolia Street in Levelland. Supernatural mystery-romance based on the Dorothy Macarle novel “Uneasy Freehold.” Directed by Daniel K. Nazworth. General admission tickets $5 for general public and $3 for students. Tickets sold at door. (806) 716-2266. 
Final performances.
